Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for eight nights from 30th of March. As written in other reviews on this site, the hotel is not up to date inside, the renovation I assume means that it has been decorated at some point. We were in room 102. This room was in the north-east corner on the first floor and had a view from the balcony of a few houses and streets. The room had a large bed which was quite comfortable. The room and bathroom were both clean and well presented. The negatives start here. The room had two big windows that opened easily with shutters outside. While these are nice, the curtains inside the room do not shut. The hotel also has no in-room internet access which should be a given in any three star hotel. Between the wall where the head of the bed is and the store cupboard outside run water pipes. These are incredibly loud when anybody in rooms above us uses these pipes. Also, either above our bathroom or outside the building there is what sounds like a water tank which is constantly making noise. The walls are paper thin so you can hear practically everything going on in rooms around you. There are also no tea/coffee facilities in the room so the only option on drinks is buying from a nearby supermarket or using the mini bar. The breakfast is terribly dull with no hot food facility. I had breakfast three times over eight days. The hotel only serves food at breakfast as well so no restuarant for the rest of the day. The hotel, whilst close to the main street and vaparetto station was very over priced. We were greeted with, " Since you are staying here for a long time, we will give you one of our best rooms." This sadly didn't happen. We asked to change rooms on the first night but were told that there were no other rooms available to switch to. I would definitely not recommend this hotel unless you can get it during the low season and don't have a room number that ends in anything from two to five as the problems we experienced probably apply to all rooms in the north-east corner of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent access to Venice but overcooked croissants”
Reviews.Author: evakama
Reviews.Content: Excellent access to Venice via the Vaporetto which is within easy walking distance. If you buy Venice Card you can get 72h ticket for water buses (you will need it anyway). Breakfast was a little bit too light but for me enough to be full. There was only choice of tea or coffee no herbal teas. Each table had two jam filled overcooked croissants, two rolls and some bread. The only other thing on offer was two sweet cakes and cold eggs. Nothing special but enough. My standard room was reasonably priced, pretty big but very basic, almost sub standard. The big disappointment however was a very bad smell in the room. Also you have to know you need to purchase the hotel WiFi for â‚¬10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: MihneaRadulescu
Reviews.Content: Best price of its class, clean and comfortable rooms, amiable service, very close to the water bus station. Abysmal breakfast without meat or cheese of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Atlanta Augustus, lido, Venice”
Reviews.Author: ShilpiDas
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel ! Although it looks pretty old and rustic from outside, its totally renovated and upto date on the inside. Staff are nice and helpful. Reasons for 4 stars: - a) No internet facility. In this day and age lack of internet in the room is a spoiler. b) No tea/coffee kettle in the room. This small addition can make such a huge difference in the quality of the stay. c) Finally, the breakfast is extremely boring. There is not even a bread toaster for some hot food. The choice of the spread is plain boring. I guess it will cost less than 500 Euros to set the above things right and the make the stay excellent. Another thing to bear in mind is that the hotel is in Lido and not main Venice Island. It costs 13Euros for a return trip to Venice. Something to bear in mind for someone on a budget. For tow people 26Euros return is quite a steep price to pay. Although its no fault of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Patty650125
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Venice but were recommended to stay on The Lido by someone who lives in Venice. He was absolutely right. The hotel was a five minute walk to the water transport and then just a 15 minute water bus journey to S. Mark's Square. We did all the tourist things we were supposed to do but could return to the tranquility of The Lido. I really did not like being in the centre of Venice with all those crowds of people and so was so glad to go back to The Lido. The hotel was much better than we had hoped. It was a very high standard 3 star hotel. We had a good sized very pleasant room on the 2nd floor. The decoration of the room was a bit strange with every colour you can think of in it. Such a shame because natural colours would have been so much better. It had a really good bathroom and the whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The breakfast area was basic but we had a very good continental breakfast. The weather wasn't warm enough but next time we go we will hopefully be able to sit in the garden to have breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is brilliantly situated just five minutes walk to the water transport, 10 minutes walk to the beach and the boulevard with its lovely shops, coffee bars etc. is on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “A bit more than a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Opal043
Reviews.Content: We were turned away from our 'booked' hotel due to plumbing problems but my friend and I were taken a short walk to the Atlanta Augustus. We had a large corner triple room. The bed arrangements were soon put to rights - we had been unexpected after all. We were met with a friendly service. The breakfast was better than expected - not just croissant and coffee. The hotel is within a 15-minute stroll to the water taxi terminal and not too difficult, flat pavements. The shower room was certainly adequate and we enjoyed our 3-night stay there,

Reviews.Title: “NOT IN THE CENTRE OF VENICE BUT WORTH THE TRAVEL”
Reviews.Author: StewBnufc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as part of a larger package and after reading earlier reviews we were hopeful of enjoying a pleasant stay. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is on Lido De Venice an island a short ferry trip from St Marks Square and could be summed up as "Far from the madding crowd" - it allows you to escape the vast numbers of tourists in the heart of Venice, to find good quality food and drink at reasonable prices and to receive excellent customer service. We were fortunate to get the last available room (number 404) which came with a beautiful terrace overlooking the local canal and with a skyline view across to Venice. It was an unexpected bonus which helped to make our holiday. If you choose to use this hotel ask about the 4th floor rooms as they all appear to have a terrace. From the moment we arrived to the time we left we felt welcome and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Breakfast was 'continental' with cereals, breads, croissants, boiled eggs, cream cheese, etc supported by fruit juices and excellent coffee. No complaints there. Our room was spotlessly clean with a nice sized on-suite, TV, and easy to use safe. It had an interesting round, domed ceiling painted to look like clouds in a blue sky ! The hotel is easily found down a quite street about 2-300 metres from the ferry terminal and has lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. There's also the beach about 10 minutes walk away, it's really well worth a visit. The only 'downside' to the hotel could be the fact that you have to travel by ferry to reach the heart of Venice, but it only takes a few minutes and there are very regular ferries. The cost for each journey is 6.50 euros which in truth is a rip-off when set against the cost to locals (1.50 euros). If you're likely to make multiple journeys (we did) to Venice and other islands such as Murano, Burano (both a must) look at the various multi-ticket offers. If you get your timing right you can make these very attractive because you'd have to pay from Venice anyway. Work out your timings to get max value from a 12, 24 or 36 hour ticket. We bought a 12 hour ticket for 16 euros and did all we wanted to do across a single day starting about 10.00am. To sum up one small downside but so many positives make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the Venice area”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewerNW
Reviews.Content: Pros 1. Great location close to the ferry terminal on Lido and a 10 minute walk to Lido beach 2. Very nice rooms with some pretty cool decor 3. Very friendly and helpful staff 4. Great price (lowest price we could find in the Venice area) 5. Good breakfast, included with the room 6. Easy walking distance to restaurants, bars and gelatarios 7. Fast internet access 8. Easy access to Venice by boat Cons 1. Wifi access does not extend to the rooms; you have to be in the lobby or near the elevator We stayed for just one night in Lido when visiting Venice. We flew into Marco Polo airport and took the Alilaguna water taxi from the airport which dropped us off at the ferry terminal - about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel website has good directions from the ferry terminal and Lido island is not complicated to navigate which means finding the hotel is straightforward. The staff is communicative via email and phone as well. We stayed in a double bed and the room and the bathroom were very clean. There was A/C in the room (a big plus, Venice was warm and humid even in mid September) and very interesting decor/paint color in the rooms. The internet as stated before is fast, but wifi does not extend to all the rooms, at least not to the 2nd floor where we were staying; you have to be in lobby for wifi access to work properly. There are restaurants, bars and gelatarios (open at least till midnight) within easy walking distance so you can grab a bite to eat if your flight lands late at night like ours did. Breakfast is good (cereal, boiled eggs, meats, fruit juice) and is served starting early morning in the hotel. Lido beach is very close (worth visiting) and car parking is also available (we did not use it). The major drawback of course is that this is Lido, not Venice itself so it takes some time (45 minutes or so) to get to the city by water taxi. Water taxis are also spendy per trip, so that would be something to keep in mind if you are planning to commute back and forth from the city. We checked in the night before, checked out in the morning, dropped our luggage off in Venice train station (direct water taxi from the Lido ferry terminal), did Venice in the morning and afternoon and left Venice in the evening by train.

Reviews.Title: “average but clean”
Reviews.Author: traveller20000
Reviews.Content: We reserves 4 rooms for our family trip to Venice at Atlanta Augustus Hotel. It has a convenient location to the water bus, but I think it is a big mistake to stay out of the main Island where the tourist attractions( squares, canals, and gendolas) are. Even with higher prices of hotels there, it still more fun and less hastel to stay where attractions are. Water transportation is also very costly, and this adds up to expenses of staying out of the main island. Anyway, the hotel was really clean and breakfast was ok for a three stars hotel. Staff were generally helpful except for one who was rode and aggressive for no apparent reason! Car parking is very small, and I would suggest that visitors leave their cars in the parking outside the island before they take the fairy. This way, not only save the cost of transporting the car, but also find more reasonable parking for un-needed car. Another buthersome issue was the fact that the hotel insisted in charging 20 Euros extra charge for a child eventhough we made the reservation of one of the rooms for three persons!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well positioned”
Reviews.Author: mtervaportti
Reviews.Content: This hotel has friendly staff and is optimally located for people who want to be centrally located but not disturbed by traffic. Many restaurants and bars are found in the vicinity. The distance to the water bus terminal (for Venice, Murano, airport etc.) is less than 500 metres (1/3 miles). The free beach on the Adriatic side of Lido is less than 1 km (2/3 miles) away. There are some playing parks for children in Lido (by bus or bicycle), and a good one in Giardini (one or two water bus stops away). Air condintioning is fine, 10 eur for wifi is very reasonable and it works, our room was optimal for our two kids. And the staff was very friendly indeed. Breakfast was simple, a good extra were the boiled eggs that belong to it every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good room not impressive from outside”
Reviews.Author: laxrajan
Reviews.Content: good things - good room and comfortable beds, free breakfast. They also kept our luggage after check out when we went to see Venice The hotel doesn't look very impressive from the outside, but the rooms were good and comfortable breakfast was very basic

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Keeponexporing01
Reviews.Content: Made the booking last minute (3 days before travelling, to fit in with work commitments!) and it is an average hotel, a reasonable place to stay, but there are no amenities. The exterior suggests a very pleasant hotel, however, the interior does not live up to expectations. On the plus side the location is not far from the water taxis nor the the main strip of shops/bars(then again not difficult as the Island is only small) All areas of the hotel appear were quite clean. The bedroom was basic with no aircon (Italy in May is warm, it must be unbearable in July) There was a TV in the room but it was tiny and no English channels nor film option (Yes, when on holiday the idea is not to stay in your room, but you cannot stay out all day/night) The breakfast area was very basic as was the breakfast on offer. The bar area can barely be called as such, it is an after thought. Finally, the hotel staff. Other than a Good Morning/Evening there was no interaction, no asking how I was finding the Lido, what I thought of Venice etc, they seemed quite distant/uninterested. I think the lack of lounge/bar area meant no relationship was created. Wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend unless like me the rate was very good. The average I've given the hotel is down to the rate I paid, if I'd paid more, it would have been a poor. As a suggestion go to the Ausonia Hungaria hotelfor a drink (just 3 euro for a beer, which compared to most was very cheap) & something to eat (Better still check rates and stay there!) It is a larger hotel on the main strip which is set back and looks quite grande with seating outside which is very nice. Welcomed with a smile and a chat from the bar lady (Jelena) who was very nice. All in all the Lido is a pleasant place to go and unwind. It isn't a place to be wowed. Beach was ok and was fairly quiet. As for Venice, it was something of a disappointment. Yes, it is pretty and the water taxi has a novelty value but it is a lot of very nice! You wind around street after street which is ok at first, but grows tiresome as other than a tiny square with cafe/bar there is little to see. Quaint squares and a sitting down somewhere is all well and good late in the day after a busy day of sightseeing, but not when that is the sight to be seen and it is only 10:00 in the morning. If staying for more than a few days get the 7 day water pass for 50 euro (water taxi runs throught the night every 20/30 mins) and use the Alilaguna water bus from Marco Polo airport to the lido. (red line is quicker as it has fewer stops, blue more scenic, stops include St Marks) Alilaguna tickets office is a left turn after reclaiming baggage and entering the main foyer.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was in a good location and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: herb80
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small and not like any of the ones pictured on the website! It was however very clean. Unfortunately there was a constant buzzing sound which kept me awake. They assured us that there was no heating or air conditioning on, but the buzzing persisted. We were offered another room which we moved to. On the plus side, good quiet location, very clean on the minus side buzzing noise, tiny bedroom, minimal breakfast. The desk staff were variable from useless to very helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: 186534Jono
Reviews.Content: This hotel situated in Lido one of the south islands of Venice was very nice. We enjoyed the fact that it was out of the way of the busier parts of venice and it was very easy to get the ferry boat (5min walk from hotel) into Venice to see all the sights. If visiting Venice again we would stay in Lido I think as Venice gets very busy and its nice to have that quiter part to escape to. The surrounding location was a very nice neighbourhood, there was plenty of restaurants/shops and bars and it felt safe. We only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights but wish we had longer. The man on reception who met us on arrival was very friendly, happy and helpful. Our room was cute, clean and roomy. Breakfast was at a good time and of good quality. Overall a good experience, Venice is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “I do love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lacollinedesel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights with my old parents. Generally I am very very satisfied with the stay. I can recommend this hotel to anybody. â—�Good Point 1. Spacious room: We were given very spacious lofted room for 3 persons. It could be almost impossible to find more spacious room at such a reasonable price in Venice. Most hotels in Venice offer a very small room at a very high price.. 2. Staff: They were very kind, friendly and helpful. I felt like at home during my stay. 3. Cleanness: Every part of this hotel was clean enough. Very comfortable. 4. Location: Though it locates a bit far from the waterbus stop, it's possible to get there by foot (around 10 minutes). You can also find some bars and restaurants near the hotel. â—�Bad point 1. Breakfast: For me the breakfast is o.k. but for those who need the American style breakfast (a full of variety) the breakfast could be a bit poor. We are served two sorts of bread, Yogurt, orange juice, coffee, tea, milk, that's all. 2. The access to the main sightseeing area: You always need to take a waterbus to do sightseeing. I like to be on a waterbus, but for those who economize the time for travelling had better choose the hotel in the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “charming.......perfect location in venice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: newfies3
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the perfect location when visiting venice.....away from the huge crowds in st. mark's square! after spending time at the usual tourist stops in venice it is so nice to hop on the ferry to arrive at this quiet, beautiful little island just 10 minutes away! our hotel room was quite small compared to others we stayed (302) but they still managed to accomodate us with a crib for our 6 mth old and she slept quite soundly! i celebrated my birthday during our short stay in venice and upon returning to our room after a long day, i was greeted with a little bottle of champagne and glasses for my husband and i....i thought this was so thoughtful and such a nice surprise! we found the service impeccable.....making up her little cot just so everyday and provided us with the only kettle they had so i could prepare food for our little one....you don't get this service just anywhere....and we have stayed at many hotels during our travels. we would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel with a location that is not only beautiful but very convenient....the location is like a vacation outside of the vacation you are already on! our only regret is that we didn't get to spend any time at the beautiful beach that is just a 5 minute walk from the hotel.....it's like a little secret nobody knows about......we would return just to spend time on this little island and at this gorgeous beach (no tourists like the ones that block every other beach) and we would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat but ask for a bigger room next time as a child doesn't travel very light!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Room, Four Star Location”
Reviews.Author: John and Linda Hunter
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day stay here after a week's glorious cruise around the Greek Isles in a compact cabin with plenty of wardrobe/drawer space. Our Standard room was reasonably priced, but very basic, almost sub standard. No drawers to unpack your cases, no dressing table to sit at and do your hair, only a single wardrobe for a double room - a basic Travel Lodge room in th UK was far more comfortable. We were on the 3rd floor with a small window overlooking the canal, with what can only be described as a flimsy piece of fabric masquerading as a curtain. Avoid Room 304. The bathroom was good and clean. Breakfast very average, no fresh fruit, machine coffee, filled croissants and the pretty outside gardens were not laid out for breakfast. Most disappointing. Customer Service at Reception was very poor, no warm welcome, not even a cheery goodbye. This hotel could be so much better with a good location, handy for bars, restaurants, etc in the delightful Lido. We would return to Lido, but not to this hotel. The Hotel Rigel just around the corner looked far better for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: marysia9
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 couples visiting late May 2010. We liked the hotel, our room was very antique style, not bad size a bit tight round the bed but noproblem, lovely bathroom and shower, plenty of space On the lower floor friends had more modern style, still very pleasant. Breakfast lovely, more than we expected for the price. Location pretty perfect as long as you have a trolly case - easy walk up Santa Marie Elizabeth and turn right at the round fountain, close to a number of restaurants - we particularly liked the one just 100 yards further down the Lepanto - no 21 I think. We bought the Vaporetto season ticket for 3 days (33 Euro) and it worked out very well. The beach is a few hundred yards down Santa Maria Elizabeth. A very good Location! Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous terrace”
Reviews.Author: Cheslll
Reviews.Content: 1st time to Venice, I was a bit unsure about the Lido, but the hotels looked so much better for the price. Arriving there by ferry at midnight by the light of the full moon was magical! As soon as we stepped off the ferry we loved the Lido. It was so civilised and charming. Full of tree lined blds and lots of bikes. The hotel is a v short , delightful walk from the ferry. Plenty of places stay open late..including gorgeous gelateria. We were very happy when we arrived at the hotel, it's overlooking a little canal and very romantic. The hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. We were asked if we wanted to pay for an upgrade with a terrace. Once we had seen the room we grabbed the chance. The sun was shining and we had our own terrace with gorg view in Venice, we couldn't believe it. Would definitely recommend and I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant. Quiet area, affordable, and they had space for 4 of us in one room.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMarta
Reviews.Content: After a day of walking around and sightseeing - it was nice to hop onto the vaporetto, feel the breeze as we arrived on the much quieter lido, and walk over to the beach to soak up a few last rays of sun. A much more civilized way to enjoy Venice, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chacha43
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our budget airline package and the price we paid for four nights was so low in comparison to other hotels on offer that we were slightly concerned that it was "too good to be true" and we might get inferior accommodation, especially as we stayed over the Easter weekened. However we were very pleasantly suprised with the room, which was spacious and came with a balcony and a Spa bath. The bed was large and very comfortable and the location of the hotel in a residential area meant that it was very quiet. By the way, my husband and I loved the filled croissants at breakfast! The best thing about the hotel was the location. I would recommend staying here as opposed to staying in Venice itself as coming back here after exeriencing the crowds was a relief every day. We were lucky enough to experience some great weather and spent time on beach recoperating from walking all around Venice. The beach is only a 10 minute walk away and when we were there it was not crowded although I should imagine it will in the summer. If you can cope with the daily 10 minute commute into Venice then I highly recommend you stay on Lido and you can do a lot worse then staying in this small hotel!

Reviews.Title: “venice but without all the tourists”
Reviews.Author: lequon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Lido. You can reach the Lido from the airport and Venice (main centre) by using the Vaparetto. If you buy a ticket from the airport on arrival for your entire trip then you will save. The hotel is only a short walk from the Lido stop (St. Eliz Maria). The nearby Garadini restaurant is worth a visit. Nothing flashy but good value for money and lots of locals. The man at the front desk is a bit strange. He asked for our passport and then gave us the key to our room. He said he would give our passports back in five minutes. He didn't come to give them back so we popped in on our way out that evening to get them. He then took our key back and said we had to leave our passports there each time we left. I actually thought that as a tourist you are meant to have photo ID on you when travelling about. In any case we didn't feel comfortable leaving our passports with this man and just left via the back door! A bit strange and possibly dodgy. Breakfasts are OK and the waitress is quite friendly. Overall though very clean and there are fridges in the room so you can do a small amount of self catering.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: Supershoosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to public transporation and especially to the waterbus station. It is located near a canal, in a quiet neighbourhood. The staff is very helpful and most important - speaks English (not very common in Venice). The room (302) was small, yet very clean and well equiped. The breakfast was standard. Wireless internet access is valid only in the lobby/garden, for 5 Euros for the staying period. Overall, it has been a very nice experience. We recommand it!

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Crack-O-Noon
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad room here on Orbitz at an insanely low rate for late March. The hotel had a building permit sign out front, so I assume they may have just reopened, or perhaps it was just a seasonal special. We had no problems with any construction. In regards to a few earlier comments, this is one of the many hotels in Europe that have 20-30 rooms. It is a 3-star hotel. The lobby is small, but I found it very clean, neat and well appointed. There is a â€œbarâ€� that was likely added just to get a â€œstarâ€� for the hotel, and they will gladly make you a drink, but there is nobody actually drinking at the bar. I did get a glass of wine to take up to the room. The staff spoke plenty of English for me, but I must say I hate reviewers who check in to a moderately priced (for Venice) hotel expecting all of the staff to speak perfect English. Perhaps these people should vacation in Detroit. The rooms were decent, not fancy. The beds were comfortable. We were supposed to have a quad room and for some reason were given a triple. When I brought this to the attention of the desk manager we were just given an additional double down the hall. Had the hotel been fully booked this might have been a disaster. As it was it was nice to have the extra bathroom in the morning. The extra bed in the triple was a smaller bed, and four lumberjacks booking a quad might be in for a rude surprise. As for the bathrooms, both of our bathrooms were very modern with modern fixtures and absolutely spotless. The shower was in a bathtub sized stall with a little ledge so a woman might be able to kind of sit to shave her legs. There might be those who could find fault with the rooms or some other aspect of the hotel, but I don't see how anyone could complain about the bathrooms. The hotel is located about a 10-minute walk to the Vaporetto station, and the ride to St. Mark's takes about 20 minutes. The cost has risen very dramatically from what is listed in the guidebooks, I presume because of the rising price of oil. The cost of a 48-hour pass cost our family of four about 100 Euros. A single ride costs 6.5 Euros, so you must buy the pass if you stay on Lido. This is an expense you should factor in when calculating hotel expenses. On the other hand, my wife enjoyed being away from the gaggle of people on the main islands. We were able to walk on normal streets at night and spend slightly less for dinner than we might have had we been in Venice proper, although it was still plenty high. One reviewer makes mention of the Lido â€œcasino.â€� I think the Lido â€œcasinoâ€� may be closed and moved to the main islands. There is a slot parlor a block away from the hotel, but thatâ€™s all it is. It doesnâ€™t claim to be a casino. Finally, one reviewer complained about the "filled" croissants. I must concur. There is nothing more disgusting then a "filled" croissant, and that was what was offered for breakfast, although the other offereings were good. I found that if I tore the ends off and ate them, I could then rip the top off and leave the nasty filling sitting on the uneaten bottom of the croissant. They were sprinkled lightly with sugar and were quite good if eaten this way. I think perhaps the hotel was filling the croissants to make the guests eat fewer of them, and from looking around at breakfast, it was working. I talked to other people who felt the same way I do about these things, so if management is reading, please ditch the filled croissants, or at least offer some plain ones.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely exterior awful croissants”
Reviews.Author: goodtogethome
Reviews.Content: When I saw the beautiful exterior of this hotel I was full of hope. It is well located and has some charming decor. The bed was very comfortable, but the early morning bin emptying and the bottle bank nearby meant that you were woken early in the morning . The complimentary toiletries included a small bar of soap a sachet of shampoo and shower cap - probably the sparsest ever for a hotel of this standard. Normally this wouldnt bother me but since the introduction of only taking cetain liquids on planes I now take little with me, so depend on hotel products. The big disappointment however was the breakfast. There was only choice of tea or coffee no herbal teas. Each table had two jam filled croissants and two rolls and two dried pieces of bread. When I asked the reception staff if it might not be possible to have plain croissants they said 99percent of our guests like them and looked at me as if I had insulted them. The only other thing on offer was two sweet cakes and cold eggs - at least I wasnt tempted to overeat as has been the case at hotels with sumptuous breakfasts. The only fruit on offer was inferior grapes and apples. The hotel had no feedback leaflets, so assume the management do not care what their guests think about the hotel . Compared to other Italian hotels which I have stayed in I can only say this didn't seem to be up to usual standard.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment. My husband and I chose to stay in Lido as a quieter and more economical alternative to the Grand Canal area in Venice - Huge Mistake. The hotel was very old and was not all that they advertised to be. I upgraded us to a "Junior Delux Penthouse Suite" - a complete joke! The jacuzzi tub was broken, the room itself was very outdated and offered no delux ammenities. The lobby was very shabby and immediately we knew that we made an error in our selections. The hotel staff spoke very little english and the complimentary breakfast was horrible, just some dried rolls and coffee. Considering the additional costs of daily transportation to and from main Venice (you must take water taxi's) there was zero benefit in staying in Lido. Lido itself is a lovely residential island but their main attractions are the beach, which has closed for the season, and the Casino - which consists of several poker machines...some casino! We stayed in much nicer rooms throughout other popular cities in Italy (Rome, Lake Como, Milan) for less money.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my niece and parents for 5 nights at the start of August. Despite some temporary 'canal works' going on directly in front of the hotel, it really was in a peaceful location but with very little noise. The staff on reception were great and eager to please. The rooms were quaint - this is not the place for you if you're after mod cons - but practical and served their purpose, being clean and well looked after. Breakfast was also good. I would highly recommend both the hotel and the location - we deliberately picked the Lido so that we could have a city and beach holiday rolled into one. The well kept public beach ont he Lido is just a 10-15 minute stroll from the hotel, with plenty of bars, restaurants and shops on the way.

Reviews.Title: “a tranquil retreat from the bustle of venice”
Reviews.Author: trippers4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very comfortable and peaceful three night break at the Atlanta Augustus on the Lido and would highly recommend it to a family. Our junior suite (rm 205, sleeping 4,) was very clean, well furnished in a quirky italian way, light and spacious with a lovely big shower room and a modern 4 poster bed for us grown ups. There was a safe in the room. The variety and amount of continental breakfast on offer was very tasty and more than adequate to see us through to our first gelati! Service at the hotel was excellent. The hotel is in a tranquil and elegant location on the Lido, easily walkable from the vaperetto stop and close to good cafes and restaurants as well as a range of shops. It is a lovely retreat after the bustle of the tourists in the city. The children enjoyed the daily trip across the lagoon and it was refreshing to be amongst real Venetian commuters each day. What would we improve? There was a television in the room but italian tely is not worth watching so bring a pack of cards! Also, hot drink facilities would be nice in the room. One of the children's beds was only suitable for a child under 5'4" approximately, so this might need clarifying on booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Shame About The Room”
Reviews.Author: legbeforewicket
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We arrived in the evening and found the hotel within walking distance from the water taxis. On arrival the hotel looked lovely from the outside. We were travelling with friends and were given a room key for each couple. Our rooms were both on the 1st floor. We went to our friends' room first, which was large and spacious with balcony. We then went to our's which was room 109. We were greeted by a room 8 feet square which was just enough for the double bed and a narrow gap around it with a small recess in one wall for hanging a few clothes in. We were travelling with 2 suitcases as we were joing a cruise in Venice and found there was no room to put our suitcases. Luckily our friends took them down to their room. The hotel was very noisy at night and we had people knocking on our door through the night (we assume in error). Rooms were definitely not 3 star standard, even the large one. Room 109 doesn't have furniture at all besides a bed & bedside cabinets, as there is no room, only a shelf at the end of the bed and a TV on the wall. I would definitely not pay Â£80 again for this standard of accommodation. Avoid room 109 if given it.
